fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.molene.wdm

Class WiFiDisconnectionModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.es.models.AtomicES_Model
          • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.molene.wdm.WiFiDisconnectionModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MoleneModelImplementationI, EventsExchangingI, ModelDescriptionI, VariablesSharingI, AtomicModelI, ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    public class WiFiDisconnectionModel
extends AtomicES_Model
implements MoleneModelImplementationI
    The class WiFiDisconnectionModel defines a model of WiFi network disconnections.

    Description

    WiFi networks suffer from disconnections during which no data can be transmitted. This model considers that:

    • the time between interruptions follows an exponential distribution.
    • the duration of the interruptions also follows an exponential distribution.

    For simulation runs, the following parameters must be set:

    • mean time between interruptions with the run parameter name given by the concatenation of the model URI, a colon and the name given by the static variable MTBI;
    • mean interruption duration with the run parameter name given by the concatenation of the model URI, a colon and the name given by the static variable MID.

    After the runs, the report returned by this model provides three elements:

    1. the total number of generated interruptions;
    2. the availability i.e., the proportion of the simulation duration during which the WiFi was able to transmit data;
    3. a piecewise constant boolean function giving the state (connected = true, disconnected = false) of the WiFi over the whole simulation duration.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2018-07-17

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public WiFiDisconnectionModel(java.lang.String uri,
                              java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit,
                              SimulatorI simulationEngine)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        create an instance of the WiFi disconnection model.

        Contract

         pre     simulatedTimeUnit != null
 pre     simulationEngine == null || simulationEngine instanceof HIOA_AtomicEngine
 post    getURI() != null
 post    uri != null implies getURI().equals(uri)
 post    getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(simulatedTimeUnit)
 post    simulationEngine != null implies getSimulationEngine().equals(simulationEngine)
        Parameters:
        uri - unique identifier of the model.
        simulatedTimeUnit - time unit used for the simulation clock.
        simulationEngine - simulation engine enacting the model.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

      • initialiseState

        public void initialiseState(Time initialTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        initialise the state of the model to make it ready to execute a simulation run.

        Description

        The standard predefined state initialisation will set the time to the next event. Hence, if a specific model has to perform some initialisations which the first internal transition depends upon, it must first perform them and then call the inherited method using super.

        Contract

         pre     initialTime != null
 pre     initialTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 post    isInitialised()
        Specified by:
        initialiseState in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        initialiseState in class AtomicES_Model
        Parameters:
        initialTime - time of the simulation when it will start.
        See Also:
        AtomicES_Model.initialiseState(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)

      • userDefinedInternalTransition

        public void userDefinedInternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        perform an internal transition; this method is user model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Duration.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time since the last event.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.userDefinedInternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • endSimulation

        public void endSimulation(Time endTime)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        terminate the current simulation.

        Description

        This method can be user-defined, allowing to perform some catering work like gathering data or computing statistics that depends upon the end time of the simulation (and that would likely be included in the simulation report of the model).
